website_summaries.verdict: The Nexus 6P doesn't have the most inspiring design, but when it comes to hardware prowess, value for money and Google extras, this best-ever Nexus is hard to beat.
pros: One of the first two Android 6.0 phones, Google's metal Nexus 6P has a sharp, high-resolution screen and a solid camera, an accurate fingerprint reader, loud speakers and works with every major carrier
Its lower cost makes it a good top-tier value buy
cons: It's big, a bit boxy and top-heavy, the fingerprint reader's position isn't always convenient and the 6P ditches the wireless charging of previous models

customer_reviews.title: Good phone, low cost
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this phone for years. I bought it from Google, I still use it. I bought this refurbished version for my child. Good phone, low cost. Bad move. The battery is garbage, The phone goes from 100% to 50% in two hours, then immediately dies. Indicative of a bad/old battery. Very obvious the phone was not refurbished but simplly repackaged and and sold. Don't waste your money. Also refurbished unit is not sold by Huawei. So feel free it insult Amazon for for enabling fraud.
customer_reviews.author: Vance Dubberly

customer_reviews.title: Huawei makes this terrible.
customer_reviews.text: Great Phone. Miserable customer service from Huawei. Avoid this purchase and pay the extra through the Google store. My phone boot looped a month ago, and I contacted Huawei who initated an RMA (phone in warranty), but never sent a shipping label. Ive contacted them five times and still don't have the label. They have gone radio silent.

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware - Huawei support and service is terrible Warranty is meaningless
customer_reviews.text: To everyone considering this phone or another Huawei product - here is your warning. I purchased this new directly from Amazon last year, the phone is still under warranty recently noticed the metal frame around the power button the volume button crimping/bending - simple issue I thought? Called Huawei support - sent them six pictures of the phone at their request - NO REPAIR - they consider it "physical damage" - even though the frame on their phone failed. Phone has been in case and protected since day one. Beware you are on your own even if your phone is still COVERED by warranty. Terrible service. Never will I buy one of their products again.
customer_reviews.author: rhodyfresh

customer_reviews.title: Battery no longer holds a charge after a year - not an uncommon problem with this phone
customer_reviews.text: Phone was amazing for the first year. Then I noticed over a couple months it no longer holds a decent battery charge. The phone now lasts me about 5 hours (not using it for 5 hours...just 5 hours out of the day) with maybe half hour of SOT. ACCUBATTERY shows the capacity around 1700 mah which is about half of the rated mah. Just wanted to add my disappointment with Huawei. There batteries are clearly defective yet they won't touch anything outside of their one year warranty. Will never buy another product from them again.

customer_reviews.text: Great while it worked, I purchased this on October 7, 2016. Has gone into a Boot Loop. It is now a worthless paperweight!! Contacted Huawei, they say there is nothing they can do, Seems like someone would offer a refund or a trade in.
customer_reviews.author: Valentine Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Phone was great for the first 12 months
customer_reviews.text: Phone was great for the first 12 months, then 4 months later, the bootloop happened. My warranty expired 4 months later, and Huawei support doesn't have a solution other than going to a 3rd party store to fix it.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Different devices are defective! pay attention
customer_reviews.text: This device worked fine for almost 1 year, but during last week, all of sudden, I am experimenting a sustained battery drain and the device switches off at 20 % of battery left. I have been reading on internet and it seems that there are different defective models with this exact issue: after 8-12 months of life, the battery dies. Unfortunately, I cannot send it back and get a replacement, but if you really want it, buy it from a google playstore (it seems they are sending you a new working device if you are reporting this issue, even after a year!). Of course, the battery cannot be replaced by the user! I am very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Stefano

customer_reviews.title: Unusable after one year
customer_reviews.text: The battery life has degraded to such an extreme that it's unusable. The phone reboots when under a certain battery percent (sometimes 20%, sometimes 15%, etc.). The Google Store is offering full refunds and even replacement devices on purchases outside of warranty because of this issue (brand new Pixel XL phones are being sent to people who ordered directly from the Google Store), yet Amazon cannot issue a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Littleton

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy unless you are okay with knowing it will go bad within a year
customer_reviews.text: The battery stopped working a week after the 1 year warranty ran out. I called their customer service line and they offered to have me pay to replace the battery at my cost. It soon stopped booting completely without being able to get any of my child's baby pictures off of it. Do not buy unless you are okay with knowing it will go bad within a year. Their customer service doesn't care to help with any issues either.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Fails after a year...
customer_reviews.text: Got this phone less than 2 years. After 12 months the battery had noticeably less ability to hold charge. After 18 months it would last about 30 minutes of "screen on" before turning off. And it would show 50-60% battery life when it turns off. I finally got frustrated with it and decided to try and save money not buying a new phone. So I replaced the battery. After replacing the battery I can no longer get cell service. This phone is a piece of junk. almost $500 wasted. Less than 2 years of use. I'm not even going to discuss the intermittent bluetooth failure. Trash.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So the useless battery issue is real
customer_reviews.text: Bought this phone 16 months ago and all of a sudden it just started shutting off at 93%. Apparently this is a common issue and people have reported that changing the battery will do the trick. I trust that information and I'll be replacing mine. The phone itself is great, best android phone I've ever had but for an average consumer, needing to replace the battery is a major kill. I will not recommend any Huawei product in the near future.
customer_reviews.author: Santos Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Battery issues + Lawsuit = Big Problem
customer_reviews.text: Horrible phone. I loved it at first, but now I am having serious battery issues. The other morning I was filming video at 85% battery when all of a sudden the screen flickered and the battery went to 0% in a millisecond and shut off. After trying to turn the phone back on, the battery signal went on and showed me that my phone was dead. (What the heck?) So then I was stranded without a phone for the rest of the day because I didn't have my charger with me. Now I have to keep my charger with me 24/7. So disappointed in both of you, Huawei + Google!
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Stay far away from anything made by Huawei
customer_reviews.text: By far the worst device that I've ever come across. The infamous bootloop issue that renders it a useless paperweight, to its false claims of battery life make his a lemon of epic proportions. Huawei is a joke, and should be avoided like the plague.
customer_reviews.author: Kamran

customer_reviews.title: LYING, CHEATING MANUFACTURER WILL NOT HONOR THE WARRANTY
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS PHONE FROM ANYONE EXCEPT GOOGLE. All you have to do is "Google Huawei Nexus 6P Warranty" and you will find and endless number of horror stories. At this point, I don't expect them to ever honor the warranty, especially since discovering that they are treating thousands of other customers exactly the same way. Amazon has thus far told me they cannot help me at all. I will never buy another phone off of Amazon again.
customer_reviews.author: PhillyMommy

customer_reviews.title: Serious battery issues after a year and half. Phone ...
customer_reviews.text: Serious battery issues 16 months after buying the Nexus 6 phone. Phone shuts down by itself when there is still 50% battery life, unable to turn on unless it's charged for a while, when it's on, battery is 0%! Called and messaged Google, who did nothing to help. Google referred me to the manufacturer Huawei, Huaiwei says pay $150 to replace the battery. WHY? it's a 16 month old phone! I will never buy or recommend another Google phone again! Never buy any product made by Huawei again!

customer_reviews.title: A GARBAGE VENDOR SELLING RE-MANUFACTURED GARBAGE.
customer_reviews.text: #1. The device was enrolled in an android developer "Beta" program. The beta program has since ended so you can't enroll or un-enroll because the program doesn't exist anymore. So there is no support for the device even if there was such a thing as Huawei support. ...google it. #2. Powers off at 38% battery. A known Nexus 6P issue which Huawei is trying to dodge by "restating" their original TWO year warranty as a ONE year warranty. A GARBAGE VENDOR SELLING RE-MANUFACTURED GARBAGE.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: This phone was great..
customer_reviews.text: This phone was great... For about 11 months. Then it died completely. Luckily it was still in warranty period, so I sent it back. customer_reviews.author: J. Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Battery issues after a few months.
customer_reviews.text: I loved this phone while it lasted, but now the battery dies after 5 hours and with 30% battery life left. Huawei doesn't seem interested in fixing this issue by taking the initiative to begin a recall. And of course, these issues worsened right after my warranty expired.
customer_reviews.author: Destinee

customer_reviews.title: Battery dead after 15 months
customer_reviews.text: Just a couple of months after the manufacturer warranty runs out, the battery stops holding a charge. At 86% battery, the phone shuts off and won't turn on unless plugged in. Turns out this is a known problem with the 6P line. Reached out to Huawei, got no response at all. Stay away. This phone is crap!
customer_reviews.author: Penniest of the Pens

customer_reviews.title: Hardware defects with no support
customer_reviews.text: This is the first and last Huawei device I will ever purchase. Do a quick Google search and you'll see that this phone is riddled with problems, it's almost inevitable that within a year you'll run into bootloops or your battery will fail. Mine started after six months, and by the eight month mark it went from an annoyance to entirely unusable. Google told me to contact the retailer for support. Huawei told me it was under warranty and requested an address to send an RMA label which never came. Amazon was no help either. Unless you want to spend $500 on a paperweight, look elsewhere.

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend this vendor!

Even thought this phone is pre-owned, this is the best Nexus phone I have ever had, and I have been using Nexus phones for several years. Came preloaded with Android Nougat 7.0 and was 40% charged out of the box, I just had to drop in my T-Mobile SIM card and I was off and running. Since I am a Google user, I was able to setup the phone in short order. Phone was in like new condition, not a mark on the phone. Price was excellent, I am most happy that I went with this vendor, will be happy to work with them again. Thanks!!

customer_reviews.title: Good phone complete marred by terrible build quality

BUT - I've never had such a poor quality experience in a "High End" Smartphone. The screen cracked in my pocket for NO reason. I didn't bang it or anything. Don't know what happened. I paid $170 to get it repaired - and within a few months, after a small fall, the screen breaks again, completely demolishing the phone. And of course it's not covered in warranty. I feel like I've wasted $500. Such a disappointment.

customer_reviews.title: (60 percent charge and phone powered off in middle of business call) Known issue with good support via Google store but not Huawei
customer_reviews.text: It's a brick after only 15 months. Simply Google the issue with this model and abrubt power drain. After long call with Huawei customer service, they said I could pay to have it fixed. The cost was equal to getting a used refurb. So, don't buy unless you plan to refresh quickly.

However, right away it started dying at 40% battery life. I didn't return it because it seemed like it still lasted most of the day and I thought it was just a weird glitch. Then all of a sudden 10 months later, my phone doesn't even last an hour off of the charger. I am already looking at taking it to a repair shop or most likely just getting an entirely new phone.

customer_reviews.title: The phone has some good things going for it like the screen
customer_reviews.text: The phone has some good things going for it like the screen, camera, design, and speakers. However the battery on this phone now dies around 20% and it does not survive the bend test from what I have seen in youtube videos. I hope google did better with the pixels.

Very sad because it was one of the few good looking phones out there at the time, very nice design aesthetically but very poor functionality due to the battery life.

customer_reviews.title: Great smartphone, no bloatwear

It is pretty slippery in my hands, BUT with a simple case installed on it and having a nice glass protector it negates most of the concerns of me dropping this, The screen is really clear and the fingerprint reader is easy to use and google voice regonition software works better on the version of android that this shipped with (Currently July 2016)

customer_reviews.title: Love this phone. Highly recommend.

My first Nexus, and don't think I'll ever look back. It is quite large though, so be prepared if you haven't had a phablet in the past.

customer_reviews.title: The phone is very good and has nice screen and great camera
customer_reviews.text: The phone is very good and has nice screen and great camera. It a great phone overall; however, I have had battery issues with the phone dyeing at around 23% battery level. customer_reviews.text: After a year and half usage, the phone will auto shutdown when battery drops to around 35%. And the battery life got shorter, about 4hrs for regular usage. DO NOT BUY!

customer_reviews.title: Battery issues, battery issues, battery issues!
customer_reviews.text: Yet another person writing a review about the abysmal long-term battery life for this device? Yep! It started about 2 months ago, randomly dying once the phone got to 70% and now it turns off whenever it wants, once turning off at 98%. Huawei, shame on you! I regret buying this through Amazon because now Google won't do anything about it since I used a third-party seller. From July 2016 to now, from brand new to paperweight.
customer_reviews.author: Al S

customer_reviews.title: Great top end smartphone
customer_reviews.text: Great top end smartphone, even compared with the ones today. I love the design and how large it is. It is really fast and has a long battery life depending on useage. I average about 2 hours of screen on time with 50% battery left. I do everything from web browsing to playing some games and watching video on youtube. Overall great phone.
customer_reviews.author: Josh B.

customer_reviews.title: This is my first Google phone and definitely, it won't be my last
customer_reviews.text: Even though the phone is a year old, I'm still very satisfied with the performance. Everything is buttery smooth. Originally, I was thinking of getting the Pixel XL however due to the expensive price tag I just opted to get the 6p. I'm very glad that I made that decision. I love the size of the 5.7" screen and it has great speakers. Regarding the camera, I'm still testing it and so far I would give it 7 out of 10. This is my first time owning a Google phone and definitely, it won't be my last.
customer_reviews.author: Harvey

customer_reviews.title: 1 Year, 1 month and the battery life has dropped to less than 6 hours.
customer_reviews.text: A year and a month and the battery life went from days to hours. Phone was great while it worked, but the fact that the battery went so bad so fast really doesn't sit well when the price of the phone is so high. Why are the batteries not easily replaceable?
customer_reviews.author: E.Cheek

customer_reviews.title: Just get it already!
customer_reviews.text: Zero issues so far. Had it for a week now. Works on XLTE for those Verizon fanboys. HD calling works too. Everything is fairly snappy. Marshmallow has dumbed down any control over the high end camera that this phone features so you'll need to get an aftermarket camera app. Although image stabilization is very apparent in preview. Pretty cool stuff. Very happy with the phone. I purchased a dBrand skin along with a rhino bumper guard and it's a very sexy looking device. Can't get over how much the front looks like an iPhone in size and form factor though.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Puhl

customer_reviews.title: Total Piece of Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Purchased phone in June of 2016, now in October 2017 it has completely crashed with no warning. It is stuck in a bootloop, meaning it gets to the black and white "Google" screen (the screen just before the colorful wheels" and it just cycles through that continually. I warn you that you should not buy this phone. At the time I purchased it the reviews were good. In my opinion, you should be able to keep a phone for about 2 years before it collapses. This one has only lasted 1.25 years. It's a giant piece of expensive garbage do not purchase unless you would like to throw $300.00 - $600 into the garbage can.
customer_reviews.author: Mia Long

customer_reviews.title: it is a good phone. Stock Android no bloatware
customer_reviews.text: Though Amazon would not price guarantee this when fathers day sale knocked it down by $80, it is a good phone. Stock Android no bloatware. Up to date android . Quick and easy camera. Screen is crisp and good detail. Though Power button can take a bit to get used to, it comes in handy for camera shortcut. At the time of Galaxy S7 edge out, this phone is top quality and speed.
customer_reviews.author: George C.

customer_reviews.title: great phone. useless for calls.
customer_reviews.text: This phone was great to begin with. It was awesome until a couple of months when people listening on the other side started complaining that my voice is low, muffled and barely comprehendible. The problem only emanated when using the phone microphone and not the speaker for talking. I contacted huawei support who kept my phone for 2 weeks to service it. Got the phone back the phone to find the same problem persisting. Amazon was kind enough to give a refund and return on the phone. I would recommend this phone for everything except calling. If you do not talk to people, then this phone is the best out there. Picture/selfies quality beats my DSLR sometimes.
customer_reviews.author: Bhanu

customer_reviews.title: Awful support for this phone, avoid at all costs.
customer_reviews.text: I joined a class action lawsuit because this phone is flawed and Huawei doesn't want to support it. My phone battery dies in about two hours with little to no use. The battery goes to 60% and powers itself off saying the battery is dead. AVOID THIS PHONE! DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.author: RiVenoX

customer_reviews.title: Great phone when working
customer_reviews.text: Great phone when working. Had for a year and then after weekly factory data resets, decided to move on. Wish the phone worked better, but factory data resets every work, loss of everything on my phone it is time to move on. I chose this one over Samsung galaxy but this phone is completely flawed. Oh and the phone would automatically request a reset not me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Phone, Just Too Big
customer_reviews.text: Nine months into owning this phone, the only thing I would change about it is the size. Six inches is just too big for me, five would be much more manageable. Other than that, battery life, screen, and performance are all great. It's been awesome always having the latest version of Android, too.
customer_reviews.author: Justin H.

customer_reviews.title: Not built to last, don't expect help from the warranty center
customer_reviews.text: Initially, this phone was great, very fast with a long battery life. However, the battery life has dropped significantly, the metal case is bending and separating at the power button and the phone has gotten slower over time. Don't expect to enjoy it for more than a year. Update: tried to place a warranty claim and was rejected for cosmetic case damage.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: After owning it for only one year and 2 months ...
customer_reviews.text: After owning it for only one year and 2 months, the phone is now dead. The phone gets stuck in a bootloop and is unusable. Do not buy this phone!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron R.

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: Great phone, but battery shuts down at about 40-50%. Love the phone and with no response from the seller, I’ve decided to order a battery and replace it(about 20.00). Many stories of battery and boot loop problems but those who have replaced the battery seem to love it. If you are not prepared to do that, stay away! Until then back to the iphone!
customer_reviews.author: CDubb

customer_reviews.title: Stay away from this phone
customer_reviews.text: Stay away from this phone. Ever since Android Update 7.1.2 countless people have reported the phone shutting off randomly when the power drops below 60%. It has happened to me and I've only had it for a year. Flashing to an earlier edition doesn't fix it and factory resets don't fix it. Huawei says it's a software issue and won't replace it.
customer_reviews.author: b.

customer_reviews.title: Battery completely died little over 12 months later. No covered and too expensive to replace. Do not recommend. Avoid at all cos
customer_reviews.text: Battery completely died little over 12 months later. No covered and too expensive to replace. Do not recommend. Avoid at all cost.
customer_reviews.author: John J. Flynn

customer_reviews.title: Great Phone
customer_reviews.text: I really like this Android only phone. The carrier based phones have so many useless apps loaded on them they become problematic. At first I did not use the finger print ID, but after turning it on I love it. The finger ID allows you to open the phone quickly. The price performance is very good. It is quick, responsive, with the "Ok Google" feature being most helpful. The battery life could use some improvement, but the rapid charge means I'm up to full power in 15 minutes or less. The 6P is a big phone. At first I was not a fan. I've since converted. The larger 5.7" screen makes viewing movies possible.
customer_reviews.author: James Black

customer_reviews.title: Still better than an iphone
customer_reviews.text: Known Mic issues. Warranty coverage, but involves you contacting Hauwei and shipping your phone off for repairs without a replacement for "7-10 business days"
customer_reviews.author: kdsj390

customer_reviews.title: Phone is great!!! But.... has some major battery drain issues.
customer_reviews.text: The phone has been absolutely wonderful. Fast, powerful, smooth. However, since the latest update 7.1.2 there has been a huge issue with the battery draining. With no apps running in the background and GPS on power saving, etc (all of the power saving tricks) the battery drains extremely fast. I have to charge the phone at least 3 times per day during normal use. In addition, the phone will, all of a sudden, turn itself off with the battery level anywhere between 15% and 65%. It's quite frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: MisterB

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST
customer_reviews.text: Best phone I've ever had. Better than my old samsung galaxy, has way more features. Works great with Tmobile even on there LTGE network. Used to have weak signal on my galaxy now with the new LTGE im getting much better signal. Sound quality is really good, battery life is great. Rapid charge is also a great feature, must use the included charger and Also takes a usb c type connection, so those old micro usb arent going to work here. Picture quality is very clear, screen resolution is perfect. It handles apps and tasks with ease and every game works great on here.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: 100% True Don't waste your time or money
customer_reviews.text: Maybe in it's prime it was a great phone but now it's not worth your time or money. The fingerprint reader works great and its fast, The camera is really nice The rear camera is 12.5M and the front is 8m, The sound quality is great have no problem hearing anyone or watching movies,and it has 64GB of storage which is nice to have But the real main issue is the BATTERY it drains super fast and it cuts off for no reason saying the 🔋 battery is at 0% when it was at 60%. That's why I gave it 2 stars and sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Jeffreys

customer_reviews.title: Wow what a great camera and ease of navigation!

I bought this model again because I love this phone. the camera is exceptional and the pictures are beautiful... some of my friends even think I'm an excellent photographer because of the way it interprets the light... Please don't tell!
customer_reviews.author: Nebu11a

customer_reviews.title: Great physical condition, but heavily worn battery and questionable front-camera.
customer_reviews.text: The phone appears almost perfect, with only minor cosmetic scratching - the screen is unblemished. The battery is heavily worn, and the phone tends to shut down around the 20-30% remaining battery mark. This isn't entirely surprising for a used phone, though. The more surprising issue is with the front-facing camera. This is the third Nexus 6P I've purchased (one for myself and 2 for family members). customer_reviews.title: It seems to be a bit faster and have a better battery life
customer_reviews.text: I was debating upgrading my Nexus 6 to the newer Nexus 6P, but my significant other's phone broke so I gave her my N6 and decided to go with the Nexus 6P. It seems to be a bit faster and have a better battery life, which seemed to surprise me as they both have similar specs. One thing that I undervalued was the fingerprint sensor! I don't know how I could go without one nowadays! I didn't think not having to type your pin so much would help, even though there it seems less secure in my opinion. The build is nice, but it's all covered up my case anyway. Lastly, I am greatly impressed by the phone camera performance!
customer_reviews.author: Samson

customer_reviews.title: It's OK
customer_reviews.text: It works fine and the camera takes good pictures. I've been on a Windows Phone for the past two years and honestly didn't want to switch back to Android, but if you are in the same boat as me and refuse to deal with Microsoft anymore since they stopped support for your phone, then this is probably the best you can do. The updates around the first of every month are nice and I like the AC1200 wireless. Other than that there just isn't anything special here to write home about.
customer_reviews.author: Munter2

customer_reviews.title: Always turn off by itself. Some bugs with this phone.
customer_reviews.text: Very upset with this phone. I love google's phone personally, but this phone's performance is very disappointed. It TURNED OFF AUTOMATICALLY and became DEAD suddenly on the first day I used it. I've tired to restart it and plugged it to power charge still didn't work. It took me half day to fix it. Unfortunately the same problem happened again the next day, it turned off twice a day without any notices which is unusual. And it kept asking me to update the android system, three time per day, and I have to waste my time to let it finish. that's kind of frustrating for the user when you have a high expectation for it. Not a good experience.
customer_reviews.author: yani124

customer_reviews.title: Battery life
customer_reviews.text: The first year, the phone overall had excellent performance, it was fast, with amazing speakers and a great camera too, all for a great price as well. But it had some early battery issues, like dying around 10/15%, but that was only the first months, with time this issue escalated up to the point where (2 years later) the phone only works if it's plugged in. That's the only disappointment I've had with it, but it is enough to make me switch to apple since their batteries perform much better overtime. Welp can't help it I guess 🤷🏻‍♂️. So if someone is looking to buy this I would recommend that you take extreme care of the battery first and foremost.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super disappointing experience
customer_reviews.text: A really cool device, but burned off while charging one day. A guy in official service centre told me that motherboard is dead and to replace it I have to pay about half price of the new one phone. It happened after 1 year and a few months, so it was not a warranty case already.
customer_reviews.author: komis

customer_reviews.title: Bad/Deceiving Quality
customer_reviews.text: Returned the first phone because speakers gave a tin sound when turned all the way up and eventually the mouth piece speaker blew completely, disabling half of the sound and my ability to talk into the phone. Second phone I have had for 1 year and 5 months and the battery is completely shot. Lasts maybe an hour unplugged and generally dies showing more than 50% batter life left. Absolutely atrocious quality and support from Huawei is not something I would wish on anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Tanner

customer_reviews.title: Turns into a paper weight in 60 days or less!
customer_reviews.text: This worked for 60 days and the seller does not accept returns for defective merchandise at this point. I was told that in order to access or replace the battery that the screen has to be removed. Bad quality, bad design, bad customer service, and slowest shipping ever. Make a better choice and get a phone that will last longer than 60 days
customer_reviews.author: Celestial

customer_reviews.title: Fun to use then it crashed 2 weeks after the warranty expired.
customer_reviews.text: At first I loved the phone. It was my first premium phone! Others were the Galaxy Captivate followed by the Galaxy Express. This Nexus 6P lasted 1 year and 16 days before the Android OS crashed! It cannot be repaired since Huawei won't do anything about it. It cost me $499 when I bought it. I'm staying away from Android and this company.
customer_reviews.author: pamela t.

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted 1 year, 3 months :/
customer_reviews.text: This phone was my favourite ever. I absolutely love the Google phone. BUT!!! Not even 1 year and a half later, the battery drains within 2-3 hours and phone reboots or just shuts down with more than 70% battery left. It has become completely useless. Never buying Huawei products again. Waste of my money
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it,
customer_reviews.text: This is the best phone I have ever owned. Without question. It does everything so well, and any complaints I have are trivial. Huawei has made a solidly built, fast, reliable Android phone and if this is a viable option for your budget, this is the phone you should buy.
customer_reviews.author: Vince

customer_reviews.title: Useless within less than 2 years since purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Phone started dying at anywhere between 60-85% battery charge (without warning), after 1.5 years (of course out of warranty). Huawei support wants $163 for servicing it. It was a good phone while it lasted, but for that price I would definitely expect better quality and longer life. Don't buy.
customer_reviews.author: K.

customer_reviews.title: Phone doesn't hold a charge.
customer_reviews.text: This phone doesn't work, the battery loses charge in 30 seconds. It is not refurbished. I bought this as a replacement for my girlfriend since she needs to travel pretty soon and her other LG Nexus is boot looping. Now this replacement is a total lemon, thanks guys.
customer_reviews.author: mm

customer_reviews.title: Fingerprint scanner brings it to life instantly
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from Galaxy Note 4 and I absolutely love this phone. The fingerprint scanner alone is worth considering this phone. On my Note 4 I tried using the fingerprint scanner but it's just next to unusable so I quit using it. This phone you don't even need to turn on the screen, just touch the fingerprint scanner on the back and it comes to life ready to use instantly. You'll get the latest version of Android without all of the bloatware and it is priced lower than some of the other premium phones. Would I buy it again? Heck yeah!
customer_reviews.author: w3ndiscott

customer_reviews.title: Battery and Bootload Issues
customer_reviews.text: The item came with very little damages however had some issue updating the device and once that was done started to suffer from battery draining issues and bootloading issues. Amazon issued a refund of the product since neither the seller or manufacturer could provide an acceptable solution.
customer_reviews.author: Sabz

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Has NEVER held a charge and with 3 kids in which 2 have medical stuff going on... I need a dependable phone. I'm not talking about playing on the phone and it dying, I'm mean I take it off the charger from a full night of charging, and might check my son's glucose levels a couple of times a day and the phone shuts off with what it says is 31% but is really 1% and typically around 2 or 3 in the afternoon. Randomly puts my calls on speaker and airplane mode for no reason. So much for a refurbished phone, it's never worked correctly. Don't buy!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's gonna suddenly stop working one day soon with no warning.
customer_reviews.text: I loved this phone. For about three and a half months, then it froze up and perma- bootlooped exactly like my Nexus 5X did, only the 5X had the decency to let me get almost a year or of it before it stopped working for good.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Battery Failure, otherwise good phone
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this phone in August 2016, and it stopped working in January 2018. The battery is absolutely useless now, it cannot hold a charge and the phone cannot be used without being plugged in to a charger. This means it is no longer a wireless phone, but a wired phone. The camera was good but lacked image stabilization, and the dual front speakers were fantastic, until one of them blew out. Fingerprint sensor was very quick and accurate. Overall a good product, but the manufacturer does not care whatsoever about their consumers and there are many alternatives that are better.
customer_reviews.author: Alber

customer_reviews.title: Love this phone recommend to everyone!
customer_reviews.text: I've had several smart phones, Samsung, Motorola, Sony (that one was a POS) and without a doubt this phone has surpassed all of my expectations. Great battery life, I'm a heavy user phone is critical for work. Charges fast. Most importantly the call sound quality is amazing! The speakers are great. I'd get more technical but out and out this is the best phone I've ever used.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working only one day after warranty expired. Heard ...
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working only one day after warranty expired. Heard a "pop" and it went dark. Huawei has no interest in fixing it will never buy Huawei again.
customer_reviews.author: Wandered One

customer_reviews.title: Love the phone but not the battery
customer_reviews.text: Love the phone in all aspects except the battery life. I have to turn off most of the useful features to get through a day of use without the battery dying. The Doze feature does not seem to work because I wake up in the morning with anywhere from 15-40% battery drain from the phone staying awake. This appears to be a common Android problem in general but it is particularly so with the Nexus series. That aside, the display is great and the camera takes great pics - that is, until the battery runs out from actually using the phone. Probably going to return it unless a fix comes out in the next few days.
customer_reviews.author: John Fulton

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY HUAWEI DEVICE POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE EVEN UNDER WARRANTY
customer_reviews.text: So bought this phone a year ago, and it was working great for 8 months, then my battery would die after 15 minuets of use, i sent it back to Huawei 3 times and didnt fix the issue, on top of that it had a boot loop issue, after 5 months a dealing with huawei and them not wanting to replace my phone or fix it i took it as a loss . I WILL NEVER BUY ANOTHER HUAWEI DEVICE ! AND I URGE YOU NOT TOO AS WELL
customer_reviews.author: Robert Brown

customer_reviews.title: I would buy it again for sure
customer_reviews.text: Just about as good as can be expected. Sometimes it reboots a little too easily, and I don't have Nougat so far.... But overall I am very happy with it. I am using it with Republic Wireless and there are not as many dropped calls as I had with my previous carrier (TMO). So... Would I buy it again - YES!! I gave it 4 stars but would like to give it 4.5 because I don't think it's as good as an iPhone...Yet. BUT it is less than half the price and it takes a lonnnngggg time to make up that price.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: GREAT FOR A YEAR, BUT...
customer_reviews.text: I loved my phone for a whole year, until the past few months when it shuts down for no reason, and Google can't do anything for me since I purchased it on Amazon. I constantly have to have a charger with me and have it constantly plugged in. It's becoming obnoxious and Huawei won't do anything for me, and Google can't. Great phone, but it's become garbage
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Lusher

customer_reviews.title: Not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Device is wonderful, battery is terrible, after 1yr I had the battery replaced at my cost, after a couple months battery is back to giving me problems, phone shuts down randomly. I can NOT recommend this device. just google Nexus 6p battery issues, there's more information available. Since I expirenced 1yr of bliss, I'll give the phone 2 stars.
customer_reviews.author: avp1827

customer_reviews.title: and best battery life in a Nexus phone yet
customer_reviews.text: Solid construction, and best battery life in a Nexus phone yet. Fast charging is great, too. However, it drops signal and completely loses connection to data and cellular for calls all too regularly leaving your carrier to scratch their head, and tell you that since it is unlocked and provisioned specifically for their network it just may do that from time to time. Takes solid photos in a vast variety of low light conditions that borders on the impressive, often maintaining a great deal of color saturation, but video capture is just subpart. 30 fps with only electronic stabilization isn't sufficient when competitors like Galaxy S7 and iPhone 6 and 6S record 1080p at higher frame rates, yielding smoother video.
customer_reviews.author: W. Serrano

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Phone!
customer_reviews.text: I love this phone! I am upgrading from a Verizon Galaxy S3. I was a bit weary of running the straight Android no bloatware set up but my concerns have been laid to rest. It is a clean and easy transition...no BS apps that you can't uninstall. The battery life is awesome so far! I read not to condition the battery (let it completely drain) and try to keep it above 50%. it's 3PM now and after a moderate day of use I am at 80%. It's fast and does everything I need it to. I am running this phone on Project FI and it works seamlessly!
customer_reviews.author: nickmarksthespot

customer_reviews.title: I love this phone
customer_reviews.text: I love this phone. I've been a big Nexus fan since the Nexus 5. This phone is still definitely worth it even being a year old. I'm currently using my Nexus 6P with Project Fi. I've been using my phone in South Korea, Japan and now in central Texas and haven't experienced any issues. Before dropping $700-$900 on a new phone, purchase this phone first for half the price.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio Aguirre

customer_reviews.title: technical difficulties were too much
customer_reviews.text: i loved it for the first year then it became very problematic. it had so many issues with gps, call drops (i know it sounds like service issues but service is fine on other phones), and numerous others i can't think of at the moment. i also learned that support was being dropped for this model a year after purchasing it, so that probably explains the multitude of technical issues encountered. i went back to an iphone within 2-years which was sad because i initially liked the android better.
customer_reviews.author: Shavonne

customer_reviews.title: the camera is very good, but after 13 months the battery started to ...
customer_reviews.text: The Phone is very fast, the camera is very good, but after 13 months the battery started to fail, My Nexus started shutting down at 45% battery.
customer_reviews.author: Federico Reinfeld

customer_reviews.title: Very displeased
customer_reviews.text: The phone was in a ok condition. but the phone kept on rebooting after 50% charge left. The battery was no good. I was very unhappy based on the fact that it was stated the phone is fully functional other that physical wear. I had to purchase a new battery and replaced the old one as well as a new housing
customer_reviews.author: The Black Box

customer_reviews.title: Just a really great all-around phone
customer_reviews.text: Just a really great all-around phone: The screen is gorgeous, fingerprint scanner works flawlessly, camera produces great results, battery life is at least 1.5 days of normal use for me, and the pure android experience is the best mobile UI I've ever used. At $500-600 this is as good or better than $700-800 flagships from other brands, without their "me too" bloatware and UI additions. If you're buying a phone off contract, this is a great way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Herbst

customer_reviews.title: Trash Customer Service. Trash Battery.
customer_reviews.text: Phone was great until I started experiencing the popular battery issue. Phone turns off when it hits 30% battery... what a joke. Huawei doesn't even back up their product. Force to buy a new phone and I don't think I'm sticking with Huawei or even Google.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Good for a year. Paper weight after that.
customer_reviews.text: For the last year this phone was wonderful, but then the battery decided to give out. Doesn't stay on past 85% before it shuts off. Because it's past a year Huawei can't do anything without paying the price of a cheap phone. It's a shame. This was my favorite phone, one that I hoped I'd have for a while yet.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied with this phone :)
customer_reviews.text: Love this phone. I've had it for a month plus now and it's fast and no lag whatsoever. The phone came brand new and everything was legit. I'd advise you to get the 64gb though. The 32 is good but I feel that the high GB would be better. Camera is super sharp. Videos are clear.
customer_reviews.author: David n doan

customer_reviews.title: Big, but beautiful
customer_reviews.text: I've gotten used to the large size of this phone. It is fast, clear screen, big enough for this septuagenarian to read newspapers, and I prefer the Andriod OS and Google ecosystem to that of my previous IPhone/Apple environment. As a landscape and nature photographer, I found I can download the phone's location data to geocode photographs I take with my DSLR as I carry the phone without having to run an external app.
customer_reviews.author: G. T. Orwick

customer_reviews.title: Terrible battery issues that Google and Huawei won't admit or correct.
customer_reviews.text: Updating my original positive review to reflect the fact that after 17 months my phone is a $550.00 paper weight due to a failed battery. Google won't replace it and Huawei wants $167.00 to replace the battery. I hope the class action lawsuit cost both of these outstanding citizens millions.
customer_reviews.author: Darbco

customer_reviews.title: Bendgate?
customer_reviews.text: Have had this phone for about a month and I love it. It's my first phone that runs stock Android and I'm loving it. I did however pull it out of my pocket tonight only to notice it was bent. I have a case on it and only noticed because the screen looked kinda funky. I took the case off only to find the aluminum around the volume button popping out significantly due to the phone now being curved. I really love this phone but due to the fact I can't insure it through sprint (asurion) and it's evidently prone to bending even with a nice case I'm not sure what I'm supposed to do.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Will NEVER purchase another phone like this. I've had better luck with cheap phones
customer_reviews.text: The phone was terriffic up until about a month ago. Now, I can barely hear people when I make/receive a call. Yes, the volume is turned all the way up. It's my understanding that an update caused this issue, but there hasn't been much of a way to fix said issue. I'm so angry that I spent this kind of money on a phone, only to have it stop working properly after SEVEN MONTHS. Oh, and warranty? HA! Will NEVER purchase another phone like this. I've had better luck with cheap phones.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa Maechler

customer_reviews.title: Old and useless product
customer_reviews.text: It's a terrible phone. They fail to tell you, it will no longer do a software update and it turns off at 53 percent power. I've tried returning it with no luck from the third party.
customer_reviews.author: Lokes

customer_reviews.title: Great buy, amazing device.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome phone, it is extremely hard to be dissatisfied with this beautiful handset. The aluminum body is nice to hold, the only downside I can find is that is seems a bit heavy, but it really is just a nice, large phone with a big beautiful display. Some might also be turned off by the 810 processor, but I never find it overheating and performance is more than enough I find. Battery life would last anyone a day but with some tuning you can squeeze out multiple days. Overall a great buy, but if you want the leading edge of performance, you might want to consider a phone with the 820, but you won't find one for this price point.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Racette

customer_reviews.title: Great phone even many years after its manufacturing date
customer_reviews.text: Nexus 6P is really solid phone similar to Nexux 6 that was manufactured by Motorolla. Faster CPU, I also like fingerprint censor very much, so easy to unlock. Thanks to Google it does not come with extra software from your carrier. I wish I can use it many years, but unfortunately it is breakable if you drop it, like everything else. Suggest to use covers for body and glass.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander S.A.

customer_reviews.title: Great for a year, useless after that
customer_reviews.text: Bought this phone about a year ago and the phone has started to shut off almost daily while at more than 50% battery remaining. I loved this phone's speakers, display, and responsiveness but I absolutely cannot recommend it because it becomes useless without a battery pack after a year.
customer_reviews.author: Tinuviel
